snippet: In the most far-reaching public move so far in President Xi Jinping’s drive against corruption, the Communist Party leadership expelled a retired military commander.
abstract: China's Communist Party expells retired military commander Xu Caihou, and hands him over for an investigation into accusations that he took bribes in return for military promotions; he becomes most prominent Chinese military leader to be purged in decades, and the most senior official named publicly in Pres Xi Jinping's campaign to clean up the elite and impose his authority on the party, government and army.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Michael Forsythe from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: In the most far-reaching public move so far in President Xi Jinping’s drive against corruption, the Communist Party leadership expelled a retired military commander.

headline.main: China’s Antigraft Push Snares an Ex-General
headline.print_headline: China’s Antigraft Push Snares an Ex-General
